revised_title: Plant-Remains from the Downtonian of England and Wales: A Review
tldr: This study examines plant remains from the Downtonian period in England and Wales, focusing on various types of fossils and their significance in understanding plant evolution during the Silurian-Devonian transition. The author discusses the challenges of collecting and examining these fossils, as well as the importance of understanding their morphology and context within the geological formations.
